text.div:
Properties

CodeURLTypeDescription
statushttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#statuscodeStatus of the concept
deprecatedhttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#v2-table-deprecatedcodeVersion of HL7 in which the code was deprecated
v2-concCommenthttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#v2-concCommentstringV2 Concept Comment
v2-concCommentAsPubhttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#v2-concCommentAsPubstringV2 Concept Comment As Published
HL7usageNoteshttp://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/utg-concept-properties#HL7usageNotesstringHL7 Concept Usage Notes

This code system http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/v2-0912 defines the following codes:

CodeDisplayDefinitionV2 Concept CommentV2 Concept Comment As PublishedHL7 Concept Usage Notes
AAP Alert Acknowledging ProviderAlert Acknowledging Provider
AC Administration CosignerPerson that cosigned the prescription
AD Admitting ProviderAdmitting ProviderThis role is used in the PRT associated with the PV1 segment, when more information about PV1-17 Admitting doctor is desired.PV1-17 Admitting doctor
AHP Authorized Performing Health ProfessionalThe specific Health Professional who has been approved to perform the ordered services for the patient.This role is used in the PRT associated with the AUT segment, which represents an authorization or a pre-authorization for a referred procedure or requested service by the payor covering the patient's health care. This code is used when the authorization is for a person.
AI Assistant/Alternate InterpreterAssistant/Alternate Interpreter
AP Administering ProviderAdministering ProviderThis role is used in the PRT associated with the RXA segment, when more information about RXA-10 Administering Provider is desired.RXA-10 Administering Provider
APO Authorized Performing Provider OrganizationThe Provider Organization that has been approved to perform the sanctioned procedures to which the patient was referred to.This role is used in the PRT associated with the AUT segment, which represents an authorization or a pre-authorization for a referred procedure or requested service by the payor covering the patient's health care. This code is used when the authorization is for an organization.
ARI Assistant Result InterpreterAssistant Result InterpreterThis role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-33 Assistant Result Interpreter has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
AT Attending ProviderAttending ProviderThis role is used in the PRT associated with the PV1 segment, when more information about PV1-7 Attending doctor is desired.PV1-7 Attending doctor
AUT Author/Event InitiatorIdentifies the entity responsible for initiating the eventThis role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where ORC-19 Action By has been marked for backwards compatibility only.Replaces ORC-19 Action By
CLPO Collecting Provider OrganizationThe organization that is responsible for collecting the specimen.This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-10 Collector Identifier, when intended to convey the organization information, has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
CP Consulting ProviderConsulting Provider
DIE De-Identification EntityOrganization, person or device that has the authority to remove a specimen identifier.
DP Dispensing ProviderDispensing ProviderThis role is used in the PRT associated with the RXD segment, where RXD-10 Dispensing Provider has been marked for backwards compatibility only.RXD-10 Dispensing Provider
EARI Expected Assistant Result InterpreterThe Assistant Result Interpreter who is expected to interpret the result (in the future).This will support filtering orders into the correct work queue of the Assistant Result Interpreter.
ED Entering DeviceIdentifies the device that was used to enter the order into the system.This role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where ORC-18 Entering Device has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
EO Entering OrganizationIdentifies the organization that entered the order into the system.This role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where ORC-17 Entering Organization has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
EP Entering PersonIdentifies the person that entered the order into the systemReplaces ORC-10 Entered ByReplaces ORC-10 Entered By
EPRI Expected Principal Result InterpreterThe Principal Result Interpreter who is expected to interpret the result (in the future).This will support filtering orders into the correct work queue of the Principal Result Interpreter.
EQUIP EquipmentEquipmentThis role is used in the PRT associated with the OBX segment, where OBX-18 Equipment Instance Identifier has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
FHCP Family Health Care ProfessionalFamily Health Care Professional
FL From LocationDescribes the location (coordinates) of the specimen/container in the previous holder / storage equipment before the move or the geographical location from which the specimen/container was moved.
MDIR Medical DirectorMedical DirectorOBX-25 Performing Organization Medical Director
OF Ordering FacilityThe facility from where the order was placedThis role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where ORC-21 Ordering Facility Name, ORC-22 Ordering Facility Address and ORC-23 Ordering Facility Phone Number have been marked for backwards compatibility only.
OP Ordering ProviderOrdering ProviderThis role is used in the PRT associated with either the ORC segment, where ORC-12 Ordering Provider, OBR-16 Ordering Provider, ORC-24 Ordering Provider Address have been marked for backwards compatibility only, or the OBR segment, where OBR-16 Ordering Provider has been marked for backwards compatibility only; the RXO segment, when more information about RXO-14 Ordering Provider's DEA Number is desired; the RXE segment, where RXE-13 Ordering Provider's DEA Number has been marked for backwards compatibility only.ORC-12 Ordering Provider, OBR-16 Ordering Provider, RXO-14 Ordering Provider's DEA Number, RXE-13 Ordering Provider's DEA Number, ORC-24 Ordering Provider Address
OPO Ordering Provider OrganizationThe organization the ordering provider is associated with.This code is broader than Referring Provider Organization (RPO); it can be used for inter and intra-organizational orders.
OS Outside Site(s) Where Observation May Be PerformedOutside Site(s) Where Observation May Be PerformedThis role is used in the PRT associated with the OM1 segment, where OM1-27 Outside Site(s) Where Observation May Be Performed has been deprecated.Replacing OM1-27 Outside Site(s) Where Observation May Be Performed
PB Packed byPacked by
PH PharmacistIdentifies the person taking responsibility for the prescription dispenseThis role is used in the PRT associated with the RXE segment, where RXE-14 Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID has been marked for backwards compatibility only.Replaces RXE-14 Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID
PI Primary InterpreterPrimary Interpreter
PO Performing OrganizationPerforming Organization
POMD Performing Organization Medical DirectorPerforming Organization Medical DirectorThis role is used in the PRT associated with the OBX segment, where OBX-25 Performing Organization Medical Director has been marked for backwards compatibility only
PP Primary Care ProviderPrimary Care Provider
PPH Patient Preferred PharmacyPharmacy the patient would prefer to use for any future medication orders.When a patient registers, this allows a system to indicate the default pharmacy to which the provider should send prescribed medication orders.Most likely to be used in ADT messages for outpatient care.
PRI Principal Result InterpreterIdentifies the person responsible for interpreting the results of the study/testThis role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-32 Principal Result Interpreter has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
RCT Results Copies ToResults Copies To
RHP Referring Health ProfessionalThe Health Professional who refers the patient.
RIE Re-Identification EntityOrganization, person or device that has the authority to assign a specimen identifier.
RO Responsible ObserverResponsible ObserverThis role is used in the PRT associated with the OBX segment, where OBX-16 Responsible Observer has been marked for backwards compatibility onlyOBX-16 Responsible Observer
RP Referring ProviderReferring ProviderThis role is used in the PRT associated with the PV1 segment, when more information about PV1-8 Referring doctor is desired.PV1-8 Referring doctor
RPO Referring Provider OrganizationThe Provider Organization that refers the patient.
RT Referred to ProviderReferred to Provider
SB Send bySend by
SC Specimen CollectorThe person that collected the specimen.This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-10 Collector Identifier, when intended to convey person information, has been marked for backwards compatibility onlyOBR-10 Collector Identifier
TL To LocationDescribes the location (coordinates) of the specimen/container in the previous holder / storage equipment after the move or the geographical location to which the specimen/container was moved.
TN TechnicianTechnicianThis role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-34 Technician has been marked for backwards compatibility only
TR TranscriptionistTranscriptionistThis role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-35 Transcriptionist has been marked for backwards compatibility only
VP Verifier (Verifying Person)Identifies the person verifying the dispense / a step in the dispense process / verifying the treatment corresponds to the orderThis role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where Replaces ORC-11 Verified By has been marked for backwards compatibility onlyReplaces ORC-11 Verified By
VPS Verifying Pharmaceutical Supplier (not sure how to dissect Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID)Verifying Pharmaceutical Supplier (not sure how to dissect Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID)RXE-14 Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier IDUse of this code is deprecated; depending on the role of the person use either PH or VP.
VTS Verifying Treatment Supplier (not sure how to dissect Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID)Verifying Treatment Supplier (not sure how to dissect Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID)RXE-14 Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier IDUse of this code is deprecated; depending on the role of the person use either PH or VP.
WAY WaypointWaypoint
WAYR Waypoint RecipientWaypoint Recipient

name: Participation
title: participation
description: HL7-defined code system of concepts that represent functional involvement of a caregiver or member of a care team with an activity being transmitted (e.g., Case Manager, Evaluator, Transcriber, Nurse Care Practitioner, Midwife, Physician Assistant, etc.).  Used in HL7 Version 2.x messaging in the PRT segment.
purpose: Underlying Master Code System for V2 table 0912 (Participation)
copyright: Copyright HL7. Licensed under creative commons public domain

property.description: Version of HL7 in which the code was deprecated

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the PV1 segment, when more information about PV1-17 Admitting doctor is desired.
PV1-17 Admitting doctor

concept.definition: The specific Health Professional who has been approved to perform the ordered services for the patient.

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the AUT segment, which represents an authorization or a pre-authorization for a referred procedure or requested service by the payor covering the patient's health care.  This code is used when the authorization is for a person.
This role is used in the PRT associated with the RXA segment, when more information about RXA-10 Administering Provider is desired.
RXA-10 Administering Provider

concept.definition: The Provider Organization that has been approved to perform the sanctioned procedures to which the patient was referred to.

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the AUT segment, which represents an authorization or a pre-authorization for a referred procedure or requested service by the payor covering the patient's health care.  This code is used when the authorization is for an organization.
This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-33 Assistant Result Interpreter has been marked for backwards compatibility only.

This role is used in the PRT associated with the PV1 segment, when more information about 
 PV1-7 Attending doctor is desired.
PV1-7 Attending doctor

concept.definition: Identifies the entity responsible for initiating the event

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where ORC-19 Action By has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
Replaces ORC-19 Action By

concept.definition: The organization that is responsible for collecting the specimen.

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-10 Collector Identifier, when intended to convey the organization information, has been marked for backwards compatibility only.

concept.definition: Organization, person or device that has the authority to remove a specimen identifier.

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the RXD segment, where RXD-10 Dispensing Provider has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
RXD-10 Dispensing Provider

concept.definition: The Assistant Result Interpreter who is expected to interpret the result (in the future).

property.valueString: This will support filtering orders into the correct work queue of the Assistant Result Interpreter.

concept.definition: Identifies the device that was used to enter the order into the system.

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where ORC-18 Entering Device has been marked for backwards compatibility only.

concept.definition: Identifies the organization that entered the order into the system.

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where ORC-17 Entering Organization has been marked for backwards compatibility only.

concept.definition: Identifies the person that entered the order into the system

property.valueString: Replaces ORC-10 Entered By
Replaces ORC-10 Entered By

concept.definition: The Principal Result Interpreter who is expected to interpret the result (in the future).

property.valueString: This will support filtering orders into the correct work queue of the Principal Result Interpreter.
This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBX segment, where OBX-18 Equipment Instance Identifier has been marked for backwards compatibility only.

concept.definition: Describes the location (coordinates) of the specimen/container in the previous holder / storage equipment before the move or the geographical location from which the specimen/container was moved.

property.valueString: OBX-25 Performing Organization Medical Director

concept.definition: The facility from where the order was placed

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where ORC-21 Ordering Facility Name, ORC-22 Ordering Facility Address and ORC-23 Ordering Facility Phone Number have been marked for backwards compatibility only.

This role is used in the PRT associated with either the ORC segment, where ORC-12 Ordering Provider, OBR-16 Ordering Provider, ORC-24 Ordering Provider Address have been marked for backwards compatibility only, or the OBR segment, where OBR-16 Ordering Provider has been marked for backwards compatibility only; the RXO segment, when more information about RXO-14 Ordering Provider's DEA Number is desired; the RXE segment, where RXE-13 Ordering Provider's DEA Number has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
ORC-12 Ordering Provider, OBR-16 Ordering Provider, RXO-14 Ordering Provider's DEA Number, RXE-13 Ordering Provider's DEA Number, ORC-24 Ordering Provider Address

concept.definition: The organization the ordering provider is associated with.

property.valueString: This code is broader than Referring Provider Organization (RPO); it can be used for inter and intra-organizational orders.

concept.display: Outside Site(s) Where Observation May Be Performed
concept.definition: Outside Site(s) Where Observation May Be Performed

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the OM1 segment, where OM1-27 Outside Site(s) Where Observation May Be Performed has been deprecated.
Replacing  OM1-27 Outside Site(s) Where Observation May Be Performed

concept.definition: Identifies the person taking responsibility for the prescription dispense

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the RXE segment, where RXE-14 Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID has been marked for backwards compatibility only.
Replaces RXE-14 Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID
This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBX segment, where OBX-25 Performing Organization Medical Director has been marked for backwards compatibility only

concept.definition: Pharmacy the patient would prefer to use for any future medication orders.

property.valueString: When a patient registers, this allows a system to indicate the default pharmacy to which the provider should send prescribed medication orders.
Most likely to be used in ADT messages for outpatient care.

concept.definition: Identifies the person responsible for interpreting the results of the study/test

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-32 Principal Result Interpreter has been marked for backwards compatibility only.

concept.definition: The Health Professional who refers the patient.
Organization, person or device that has the authority to assign a specimen identifier.

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBX segment, where OBX-16 Responsible Observer has been marked for backwards compatibility only

This role is used in the PRT associated with the PV1 segment, when more information about PV1-8 Referring doctor is desired.

concept.definition: The Provider Organization that refers the patient.
The person that collected the specimen.

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-10 Collector Identifier, when intended to convey person information, has been marked for backwards compatibility only
OBR-10 Collector Identifier

concept.definition: Describes the location (coordinates) of the specimen/container in the previous holder / storage equipment after the move or the geographical location to which the specimen/container was moved.

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-34 Technician has been marked for backwards compatibility only
This role is used in the PRT associated with the OBR segment, where OBR-35 Transcriptionist has been marked for backwards compatibility only

property.valueString: This role is used in the PRT associated with the ORC segment, where Replaces ORC-11 Verified By has been marked for backwards compatibility only

concept.display: Verifying Pharmaceutical Supplier   (not sure how to dissect Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID)
concept.definition: Verifying Pharmaceutical Supplier   (not sure how to dissect Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID)

property.valueString: RXE-14 Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID
Use of this code is deprecated; depending on the role of the person use either PH or VP.

concept.display: Verifying Treatment Supplier   (not sure how to dissect Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID)
concept.definition: Verifying Treatment Supplier   (not sure how to dissect Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID)

Use of this code is deprecated; depending on the role of the person use either PH or VP.
